There seems to be nothing inbuilt in SAC story to display week over week aggregates. Please let me know a week over week report can be developed in SAC.

entry.title: New Intelligent Search Available in Beta Phase
entry.content:
If you take a close look at the search field available throughout SAP Community, youâ€™ll notice a new option in the pulldown: Beta Search. This search introduces several new filtering options, including the ability to filter by SAP Managed Tag and by question status such as unanswered questions (one of the most requested features from members!). 

Powered by Coveo, this new federated search pulls from multiple repositories, not just SAP Community. In fact, this new search will also be available on other SAP sites â€“ including SAP.com, SAP Store, and SAP Support Portal â€“ with a consistent UI and design, creating a better user experience as visitors navigate across SAPâ€™s various online destinations. 

You can narrow your search down to specific sites from the top tabs â€“ selecting Products, Community, or Support â€“ but if you want hits from various platforms, you can refine via the All Results tab. From there, you can click several options under the Document Type dropdown. For example, in addition to the standard options that you would expect for SAP Community (such as Question, Discussion, and Blog Post), you can choose Learning Journey, SAP Knowledge Base Article, and News and Press. 

Thatâ€™s a small sample of whatâ€™s available. Looking for training content from SAP Developer Center? Click the Tutorial box. Need material from SAP Help Portal? Select Product Documentation. Thereâ€™s even a Video option if youâ€™re looking for media from SAP channels on YouTube.  

Additional options will allow you to find products directly on the SAP Store site. Depending on the search topic, you may even get an AI-generated answer â€“ although the beta results will require additional learning and refinement.  

While the results above may not be completely accurate, all of this search will get smarter over time â€“ thanks to you. Coveo relies on a machine-learning model that reacts to user behavior, so your activity will play an important role in improving search outcomes. 

And speaking of outcomes â€“ as an SAP Community member, youâ€™re likely interested in what the search outcomes mean for users trying to find information on our site. We encourage you to test the beta search and see for yourself. Youâ€™ll notice some options remain the same, compared to the platformâ€™s current search â€“ such as filtering by date â€“ whereas options for searching for users and authors are gone - but will come back with later phases of the search project.

Youâ€™ll also find a few new dropdowns, including menus for filtering SAP Community results by specific products and SAP Managed Tags. You can select multiple options from recommendations or search available products and tags to fine-tune results. 

Perhaps most importantly, youâ€™ll be able to filter questions by status (answered, solved, and open), meeting one of the biggest demands from members looking to find (or provide) solutions to problems. 

During the beta phase, youâ€™ll still be able to use the normal SAP Community site search. Results for the beta search will only pull public content â€“ meaning you wonâ€™t be able to use it to find information from any private groups (if you belong to any).  

We expect the beta phase to run through the rest of 2025 â€“ possibly into the middle of 2026. Weâ€™ll provide updates about future phases in Whatâ€™s New as they become available. 

Try the new beta search for yourself, compare it to the current search, and leave your questions and observations in the comments below or give feedback via our community inbox sapcommunity@sap.com. We look forward to your feedback!

Dear Valued Customers, 
 
We are pleased to make you aware about a special opportunity at SAP Connect (Las Vegas, October 6-8, 2025) for SAP MaxAttention customers:

SAP MaxAttention Dinner Reception

During SAP Connect, we offer an exclusive SAP MaxAttention Dinner Reception, taking place October 7 to provide you the chance to connect with peers, exchange ideas, and build meaningful relationships in a relaxed setting. 

This dinner will bring together selected SAP MaxAttention customers and SAP executives in an inspiring atmosphere â€“ designed to foster focused conversations on strategic IT priorities and valuable peer exchange. Itâ€™s a great option to share experiences and strengthen trusted relationships outside the formal environment. 

In case you are interested in joining the SAP MaxAttention Dinner Reception at the SAP Connect in Las Vegas please reach to maxattention@sap.com.

What is SAP Connect?

SAP Connect is a premier event where individuals can explore innovative SAP solutions. Through thoughtâ€‘leading keynotes, expertâ€‘led sessions, and realâ€‘world demonstrations, you gain direct access to SAPâ€™s latest solutions tailored to your line of business, inspiring stories that bring real-world results to life, and engage in a high-value dialogue with SAP leadership, partners, and peers. If you're interested in learning more about SAP Connect or plan to attend, please click here.

In case of any questions donâ€™t hesitate to reach out.

Your SAP MaxAttention Team

entry.title: How to Include Overhead Costs in Product Costing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello Community,

Iâ€™m currently working on a costing scenario in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and I would like your insights.

My situation is as follows:

  • I want to produce a Finished Good (FG) along with a Co-Product.

  • I have already generated the BOM of the FG, which contains the cost of each component.

  • I created the Work Center, assigned each Activity Type (Setup, Machine Time, Personnel Time), and determined the price of each activity type.

  • When I create the Cost Estimate of the product, I can see the direct material costs (from BOM) and the direct production costs (from activity types).

ðŸ‘‰ However, what I cannot see are the overhead costs (such as administration, sales, and other indirect costs).

My question to the community is:

  • How can I generate those overhead costs in the cost estimate within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?

  • Which configuration steps do I need to follow?

  • Which applications (Fiori apps) are used to set this up and run the process?

Any guidance, best practices, or resources would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Simplifying PM Task List Migration: Iterative Loading of Operations and Suboperations
entry.content:
Why an Iterative Approach?

  • The operation numbers are system-generated or derived during the first load.
  • Suboperations must reference the parent operation Node.
  • This dependency makes it practical to load operations first, capture the operation Node, and then load suboperations.

Step 1: Creation of Custom object

Create a custom Migration object by enhancing the existing standard cockpit object by adding 3 fields at the S_OPERATIONS Structure:

  1. ZZPLNKN-Node
  2. ZZUVORN- Suboperation Number
  3. ZZSUMNR- Suboperation Node

After adding above fields in Source structure complete the filed mapping to the target and complete the customization.

 

 

Note: we need to replicate the field PLNKN for the S_MPACK structure as well, if you are using Maintenance strategy:

Step 2: Load Operations (Iteration 1)

  1. Prepare your input file with the following details:
    • Task List Group (PLNNR), Group Counter (PLNAL), Activity number (VORNR), node (ZZPLNKN)

Note: during first iteration load the records with operation numbers only to be loaded in technical terms load the task list that has blank or zero in SUMNR filed from source

 

  1. Use the custom cockpit object created to   load the operations.
  2. Capture the generated Node number (ZZPLNKN) from the output of the FM.
    • These numbers will serve as reference keys for loading suboperations in the next iteration.

Step 2: Load Suboperations (Iteration 2)

  1. Prepare a second input file including:

Note: during Second iteration load the records with Sub-operation numbers only to be loaded in technical terms load the task list that has value in SUMNR filed from source

    • Task List Group (PLNNR), Group Counter (PLNAL), node (ZZPLNKN)
    •  Activity number (VORNR) â€“ Update this filed with parent VORNR value
    • Suboperation Number (UVORN)- Should be updated in sequence
    • Suboperation Node (ZZSUMNR)- this filed is to be updated with the newly generated NODE(PLNKN) from the system.

 

  1. Use the custom cockpit object created to again load the sub-operations.
  2. Validate in SAP:
    • Suboperations should appear nested under the correct parent operations in the General Task List. Shown below

 

Key Considerations

  • Ensure the task list header is already created before starting.
  • Maintain sequence numbers correctly for operations and suboperations.
  • Validate both iterations in a test system before executing in QA or Production.
  • Log all generated operation numbers for audit and troubleshooting.

Benefits of This Approach

  • Handles dependency between operations and suboperations cleanly
  • Reduces risk of errors during cutover
  • Can be repeated for dry runs and mock loads before final cutover
  • Compatible with SAP Migration Cockpit (via staging tables) and custom load programs

Conclusion

By adopting a two-step iterative approach with Existing Migration cockpit object, you can ensure accurate loading of both operations and suboperations for General Maintenance Task Lists. This method has proven effective in avoiding errors due to missing operation references and makes the data migration smoother.

entry.title: Re: ABAP2XLSX: Generic method to load any file into an in...
entry.content:
Hello,

maybe you are looking for method worksheet->convert_to_table ?

Try to check demo program 51 (ZDEMO_EXCEL51) where this method is showcased.
Preview:

CREATE OBJECT lo_reader TYPE zcl_excel_reader_2007.
lo_excel = lo_reader->load( lv_excel_xstring ).
lo_worksheet = lo_excel->get_worksheet_by_index( 1 ).
lo_worksheet->convert_to_table(
  IMPORTING
    et_data = lt_test               "a) If you know the structure
    er_data = DATA(lref_dyn_table)  "b) Dynamic option
).

If you want it to be dynamic, you can use exporting parameter ER_DATA, where you will find generated table (type ref to data).

entry.title: Re: Can we create an intercompany stock transfer order fo...
entry.content:
Hello @Bernard_Sohier 

For S/4HANA Public Cloud, intercompany STOs (5DV/5HP) only support unrestricted stock; direct transfer of project stock with a WBS is not possible. The workaround is to receive in unrestricted stock and then repost it into project stock or handle it via intercompany project billing.
Intercompany Stock Transfer â€“ Scope Item 5DV

Advanced Intercompany Stock Transfer-SAP Help

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: PCR Payroll, requirement : EG (Employee Group) 1 shou...
entry.content: Hello Anandhusap. The screen capture you are showing is of Employee Sub-Group Groupings, which is not the same as Employee Groups. If you do a Payroll Simulation for one employee with the Display Log box checked, and drill down into the Log to PCR ZPN7, you should be able to see the Function that call ZPN7 (along with its parameters) and contents of the Input Table at that point in Payroll Calculation,. In that Input Table, some WTs will have ESG * while some others will have ESG 1 to 9. Please show us the Function call for ZPN7 and the Input line for WT 2071.

entry.title: Upskilling with SAP: Alex's Journey into the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model
Re: External System to CPI connection issue
entry.content: Make sure you are calling the correct token service URL for your BTP subaccount/tenant. SAP has known 401s when the tokenâ€™s subdomain/tenant doesnâ€™t match the CPI tenant. If the token is issued for a different subdomain the CPI will reject it.

entry.title: Setup Time in Production orders not considered correctly
entry.content:

the system is SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508.

The same behavior is observed with the Processing time - when the orders are scheduled more time is calculated than expected based on the data and the formulas in the WC.

Please advice what am I doing wrong, or where I should take a look to have logical explanation of this behavior.

Thank you in advance,

Peter Kozlev

entry.title: â€ŒðŸ‡¸ðŸ‡¬â€Œ SAP Singapore Localization Forum 2025
entry.content:
Join us on November 6th for the 2025 Localization event. This year, we will share the show case of SAP Business AI, provide essential updates on recent legal changes impacting Singapore and offer a comprehensive overview of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance solutions applicable to Singapore. Participants will gain valuable insights into SAP localization solutions designed to accelerate global digital business transformation.

REGISTER HERE 

Date
November 6th, 2025 | 9:30 a.m. â€“ 4:00 p.m. Singapore time

Venue
SAP Asia Office, Mapletree Business City (Level 3, Room 309)
                       30 Pasir Panjang road 117440 Map.

Note:

  •       The event has maximum of 120 seats. Attendance will be confirmed closer to the event date.
  •       The event will feature two parallel tracks in the afternoon i.e. SAP HCM and SAP DRC-ERP.
  •       For the afternoon session, one of the tracks will has maximum of 40 seats at Level 5, Room 515-C2, where the other track will remain at Level 3, Room 309.
  •       Human Capital Management track in the afternoon will have both onsite and online, please select your preferred attendance mode when registering. Online participants will receive a webinar link before the event.
  •       SAP Document and Reporting Compliance - Enterprise Resource Planning track in the afternoon will only have onsite, the recording will be shared in SAP Workspace: Singapore SAP Document and Reporting Compliance after the event.

Agenda
Morning Session

9:30 - Registration & Light Breakfast
10:00 - Welcome & Globalization Service Strategy
10:30 - SAP Business AI Showcase
11:30 - Lunch break 1 hour

Afternoon Session â€“ SAP HCM Track

12:30 - Overview of HCM statutory update
13:00 - Part 1- IRAS Reporting and Key Changes for YA2026
14:00 - Part 2- CPF Reporting and Legal Changes in 2025
14:30 - Break 15 mins
14:45 - Part 3- Introducing MOM OED Reporting
15:15 - Q&A Session
15:50 - Wrap up and End

Afternoon Session â€“ SAP Document and Reporting Compliance - Enterprise Resource Planning track

12:30 - Step-by-Step guide for GST online submission & Cash Flow statement and Demo of Smart form handling with AI
13:30 - The Latest updates of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for InvoiceNow (Peppol)
14:30 - Break 15 mins
14:45 - Recap of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance for GST InvoiceNow
15:45 - Wrap up and End

Additional information, including the speaker list, are available here.

entry.title: Delta Sync Issue in SSAM 2505 with Basic Authentication

We are setting up a new development application using SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM) 2505 with Basic Authentication. During testing, we noticed that delta sync is not working consistently.

Some mobile users are receiving the latest backend changes through delta sync, while others are not. This is causing data mismatches across devices.

Has anyone faced similar issues with delta sync when using Basic Authentication? Any suggestions or insights would be helpful.

Thank you in advance!

entry.title: Migration Issues SAPBO 4.2 to 4.3: PMW error and Missing Relationships with CMC Promotion Management
entry.content:
We currently have an SAP BusinessObjects BI 4.2 SP5 platform deployed on Linux, and we have installed a new SAP BO 4.3 SP3 platform on a separate Linux server.

To perform the migration, we attempted to use the Promotion Management Wizard (PMW). After entering the credentials, the wizard gets stuck at the "Logging in" stage and does not proceed further. We have verified network connectivity between both servers and confirmed that it is working correctly.

As an alternative, we used the Promotion Management tool available in the Central Management Console (CMC). Through direct import (without generating an intermediate LCMBIAR file), we were able to bring over some objects. However, we noticed that certain relationships were not preserved in the target system. For example, users lost their permissions on universes after the import.

We are using the Administrator in both environments.

Content scope: 

  • number of reports: around 300
  • universes: 15
  • users: 50

Questions:

  1. Why the PMW is not progressing beyond the login stage despite correct credentials and connectivity.
  2. What is the recommended and most reliable method to perform a complete migration of all content (including users, universes, reports, folders, and security relationships) from SAP BO 4.2 to SAP BO 4.3.

Best regards

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors Customer Conversations with Danone
entry.content:
Join us to hear firsthand about Danoneâ€™s successful HR transformation and how they have become a skill-based organization with the help of SAP SuccessFactors solutions. This session is exclusively for Customers and Prospects!

Register here!

About: 

Danone is a leading global food and beverage company specialized in dairy and plant-based products, waters, and specialized nutrition, with around 95,000 employees operating in over 120 countries. True to its mission of bringing health through food to as many people as possible, Danone aims to inspire healthier and more sustainable consumption habits. The group is committed to having a positive and measurable impact on nutrition, society, and the environment through its Renew strategy for long-term growth and sustainability

Agenda:

  • Introductions
  • Danone company overview
  • Our vision & ambition on being a skill-based Organization
  • Becoming a skill-based organization
  • Our architecture & design principles
  • Impact on Learning and Talent Processes
  • Learnings & Experience Sharing
  • LIVE Q&A Session

Highlights and Challenges:

To support the rollout of its innovative new global training program â€œDanSkills,â€ Danone has chosen SAP SuccessFactors. This large-scale project is part of the transformation of skills in the era of artificial intelligence.The aim is to offer its 95.000 employees the opportunity to train and grow in line with their career aspirations, thereby strengthening the groupâ€™s capacity for innovation and collective performance.This strategic choice reflects renewed confidence in SAP and the relevance of our solutions to support Danoneâ€™s global HR programs.

entry.title: Re: Does a Flexible Workflow API Exist for Purchasing Act...
entry.content:
Hello @yrjin 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Flexible Workflow for Purchase Orders & consider a similar question previously asked How can we trigger external workflow API for sales order approval.  They will provide more details on the possibilities available for your use case.

To summarise, based on the use case you described, there is no out-of-the-box standard API in public cloud that allows external control of flexible workflow for purchase orders/requisitions directly. However, that are alternative/hybrid methods you could consider using.

  • A recommended approach is to use the Side-by-side workflow on BTP/external system. By building the approval logic in an external system, once the status is concluded as you described in your use case, then this allows you to call back SAP through the public API.
  • A second option is to use extension points in SAP to capture status, trigger external call and then use a public SAP API to update the SAP document. This will require a BAdI and custom fields.
  • A more manual approach would be to use SAP flexible workflow to send notification to external parties. Then they respond and someone in SAP acts.

You also have the possibility to raise an influence request to SAP if your use case is critical for your business or project

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: PCR Payroll, requirement : EG (Employee Group) 1 shou...
entry.content: I can see that you are calling pcr ZPN7 through Function PIT with second parameter NOAB, but I can't see the Input Table and the ESG Grouping associated to WT 2071 (the first column on the left of the Input Table). Is it * or a specific ESGG (such as 1 to 9) ? Note that pcr ZPN7 is configured for ESGG * , and compare it's structure to pcr ZPNP which is called through Function PIT but with First Parameter GEN (and second parameter NOAB).

entry.title: Re: PCR Payroll, requirement : EG (Employee Group) 1 shou...
entry.content:
CORRECTED since only ESGG 1 should get the Pension.

From your Input Table to ZPN7, you can see that all WTs are associated with ESGG 3 (Column A on the left), so PCR ZPN7 should be that for ESGG * and WT ****, only Operation ADDWT * is there, but for ESGG 1 and WT **** you have Operation ADDWT * but for ESGG 1 and WT 2071 you make the calculation (and perhaps there is no need to call out the PERSG, but you would also have to modify your schema to add parameter GEN to the call for pcr ZPN7.

entry.title: Re: How to make storage location field READ-ONLY in CO11N...
entry.content:
Unfortunately, Personas is not able to set grid/table columns read-only. The properties of elements within those controls are not exposed to it by the backend.

There could be some hacks that may achieve what you're after, but these are neither pretty nor foolproof. Even if you would cover the area with a simple container that's not visible, you still need to deal with the user tabbing to the column and hitting F4, which will allow populating the cell from possible values. So, you would need to suppress the F4 action with a script but only if it was requested when the cursor is on that column. As said, this is rather a hack than a proper solution.

Your best bet is looking for standard backend customizing options to do this. Reach out to the application area responsible (probably PP-SFC-EXE-CON) to find out if there is such a way.

  • Look for custom development in exits such as EXIT_SAPLCOZV_001 / 002 or BAdI: WORKORDER_UPDATE or CO_ZV_ORDER_BADI.

entry.title: Re: ODP Extractors from S/4 HANA Not Visible in Dataspher...

entry.title: Re: Opening periods in SAP S4 HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
Hello @Melissa_Pineda 

This error indicates that the FI posting period for Vendors (account type V) has closed for January/February 2025.

Here is a straightforward solution for Public Cloud:

Open the App: Manage Posting Periods (Apps(F2293)

Select your Company Code and Ledger, if applicable

For Account Type: V (Vendors), make sure to set January and February 2025 to Open.

Remember to save and then re-post the supplier invoice.

Notes: Supplier invoices follow FI posting periods (not MM). If you donâ€™t see F0717A or cannot change periods, ask someone with the correct role like a General Ledger Accountant) to assist. it.

SAP Help Public Cloud: Posting Periods in General Ledger Accounting (covers opening periods by account type)

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Re: Dynamic forms Connectivity with SSAM2410
entry.content:

Can you confirm that you've completed the steps in this documentation? https://help.sap.com/docs/service-asset-manager/sap-service-and-asset-manager-configuration-guide/configuring-sap-dynamic-forms

Additionally, the default configuration will trigger form assignment after you create and release maintenance orders.

To test connectivity of dynamic forms with SSAM 2410, you can use the form explorer to manually create a form for the order. You should then see the same form on your mobile device

Thanks,

Richard

entry.title: CrystalDecisions.Shared.CrystalReportsException is not marked as serializable.
entry.content:
Hello, everyone! I am having serious problems with Crystal Reports. Currently, in my web app, I use it to generate reports or billing forms. These can be sent by email, exported, and viewed right there. The problem is that, in IIS, I am getting WAS errors that cause my application to crash. This results in all connected users being logged out. It is an application built in ASP.NET (vb) 64 bits. Currently, to analyze the WAS, I am generating dump files that I then analyze with WinDGB. In IIS, the permissions are correctly granted and the 32-bit application configuration is set to false. I only see the errors in production. I can't generate them in development to analyze them in more detail. I have no idea what is currently causing them.

entry.title: Re: Starting Process chains in BW Bridge from Datasphere...
entry.content:
CSFR is generated after you are logged in (authenticated). 

I assume that you can start Task Chains in DSP which do not use BW-Bridge. So the issue is only DSP to BW-Bridge. 

Also I assume when you start the PC in BW-Bridge manually (not via TC) in works properly.

entry.title: Re: how do do delete overlapping month in Datasphere
entry.content: Hi, there is no build-in function, but you can simulate it with tables. One inbound, the other delta. Compare via a View and load into consumption table only the 'new' records.
